thread.title: Streak over! Real loss blows title race wide open
thread.title_full: Streak over! Real loss blows title race wide open

title: Streak over! Real loss blows title race wide open
text:
Real Madrid lose to Sevilla, ending 40-game unbeaten streak, Juventus suffer another loss: EuroBeat AFP, AFP January 16, 2017 9:16am 
A STUNNING stoppage time winner from Stevan Jovetic ended Real Madrid’s Spanish record 40-game unbeaten run on Monday morning (AEDT) as Sevilla scored twice in the final five minutes to win 2-1 at the Sanchez Pizjuan. 
In a result which has blown the La Liga title race wide open, Cristiano Ronaldo’s penalty put Madrid in front 23 minutes from time. 
But Real captain Sergio Ramos’s own goal levelled before Jovetic, making his La Liga debut on loan from Inter Milan, curled home from 25 yards in the 92nd minute to take the Andalusian side just one point off the top and ahead of Barcelona, although Madrid also have a game in hand. media_camera Sevilla's Stevan Jovetic celebrates scoring a 92nd minute winner against Real Madrid. 
Elsewhere in La Liga, Valencia finally won again, beating Espanyol 2-1 to end a three-month drought and move further from the La Liga relegation zone. 
Martin Montoya scored from close range in the 17th minute and Santi Mina sealed the victory in the 73rd at Mestalla Stadium as Valencia snapped their eight-game winless streak to open a four-point gap to the relegation teams and has a game in hand. 
David Lopez netted for Espanyol in the 85th but Valencia held on to earn the elusive victory. 
In other matches, Celta Vigo defeated Alaves 1-0, Eibar edged Sporting Gijon 3-2, and Granada and Osasuna drew 1-1.
